com.samysadi.acs.core.entity

Interface RunnableEntity

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Probed
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ComputingOperation, Job, NetworkOperation, Operation<Resource>, RemoteOperation<Resource>, StorageOperation, SynchronizableOperation<Resource>, TemporaryVirtualMachine, ThinClientVirtualMachine, VirtualMachine, Workload
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComputingOperationDefault, JobDefault, LongOperationImpl, NetworkOperationDefault, OperationImpl, RunnableEntityImpl, StorageOperationDefault, TemporaryVirtualMachineDefault, ThinClientVirtualMachineDefault, TimerOperation, VirtualMachineDefault, WorkloadDefault

    public interface RunnableEntity
extends Entity
    A RunnableEntity describes a entity that can be started/paused/restarted/canceled or declared as failed.

    When the runnable state changes, a CoreNotificationCodes.RUNNABLE_STATE_CHANGED notification is thrown.

    Default runnable state when instantiating a new object which implements this class is RunnableEntity.RunnableState.PAUSED.

    RunnableEntity's children, when they also implement RunnableEntity, must not be running if their parent is not running. Thus, trying to start a RunnableEntity when its RunnableEntity parent is not running will result in an exception. In the same logic:

    • when a RunnableEntity is paused, then all of its RunnableEntity children are paused;
    • when a RunnableEntity is started, then all of its RunnableEntity children are started (if they can be);
    • when a RunnableEntity is restarted, then all of its RunnableEntity children are canceled;
    • when a RunnableEntity is canceled, then all of its RunnableEntity children are canceled;
    • when a RunnableEntity fails, then all of its RunnableEntity children fail;
    • when a RunnableEntity is terminated (other states), then all of its RunnableEntity children are terminated.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Samy Sadi , Belabbas Yagoubi

      boolean canRestart()
      Returns true if this entity can be restarted safely, and calling doRestart() on this entity will not throw an exception.

      Returns true if this entity can be started safely, and calling doStart() on this entity will not throw an exception.

      Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

      Returns true if this entity is activated and running.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        RunnableEntity clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier

      • canRestart

        boolean canRestart()
        Returns true if this entity can be restarted safely, and calling doRestart() on this entity will not throw an exception.

        Usually, this methods returns true, if these next conditions are verified:

        • isRunning() returns false;
        • Calling Entity.hasParentRec() on this entity returns true;
        • If the parent of this entity is a RunnableEntity, then it must be running;
        • Other implementation-specific conditions may also apply.
        Returns:
        true if this entity can be restarted safely

      • canStart

        boolean canStart()
        Returns true if this entity can be started safely, and calling doStart() on this entity will not throw an exception.

        This methods returns true, if these next conditions are verified:

        • isTerminated() returns false;
        • isRunning() returns false;
        • Calling Entity.hasParentRec() on this entity returns true;
        • If the parent of this entity is a RunnableEntity, then it must be running;
        • Other implementation-specific conditions may also apply.
        Returns:
        true if this entity can be started safely

      • doCancel

        void doCancel()
        Stops the entity's activity and declares it as canceled.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be canceled.

        Nothing is done if this entity is already terminated (if isTerminated() returns true).

      • doFail

        void doFail()
        Stops the entity's activity and declares it as failed.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be declared as failed.

        Nothing is done if this entity is already terminated (if isTerminated() returns true).

      • doPause

        void doPause()
        Stops the entity's activity and declares it as paused.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be paused.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this Entity is not running

      • doRestart

        void doRestart()
        Reinitializes the entity and restarts it from the beginning.

        Use this method to start again an entity after it is terminated. So, unlike doStart() this method will not throw an exception if this entity is already terminated.

        Make sure that canRestart() returns true before calling this method or you will get an exception.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must be canceled.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if canRestart() returns false.

      • doStart

        void doStart()
        Starts or continues the entity's activity and declares it as running.

        Make sure that canStart() returns true before calling this method or you will get an exception.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be started.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if canStart() returns false.

      • doTerminate

        void doTerminate()
        Terminates the entity's activity.
        This means either cancel it, or declare it as failed or declare it as completed.

        Calling isTerminated() after this should return true.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be terminated.

      • getRunnableState

        RunnableEntity.RunnableState getRunnableState()
        Returns the RunnableEntity.RunnableState of this entity.
        Returns:
        the RunnableEntity.RunnableState of this entity

      • isRunning

        boolean isRunning()
        Returns true if this entity is activated and running. This happens after a successful call to doStart() or doRestart().
        Returns:
        true if this entity is activated and running

      • isTerminated

        boolean isTerminated()
        Returns true if this entity's activity is terminated and cannot be started again using doStart(). Especially, this should return true after a successful call to doFail() or doCancel().
        Returns:
        true if this entity is terminated
